intro: Conophytum udabihense, commonly known as the "Cape Flats conophytum," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that form a rosette shape. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
